content.title: Polyarteritis Nodosa Diagnosis

key_concepts.details: Systemic symptoms, hypertension, abdominal pain, mononeuritis multiplex, skin lesions
Elevated inflammatory markers; ANCA typically negative (distinguishes from microscopic polyangiitis)
Multiple microaneurysms and occlusions in medium-sized arteries; beaded appearance
Necrotizing arteritis with fibrinoid necrosis; skin, nerve, or muscle biopsy diagnostic

content.clinical_significance: Classic PAN is ANCA-negative; affects medium-sized arteries
